intro: Urera tuberculata, commonly known as the roughleaf urera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features heart-shaped, rough-textured leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruits are spherical berries that turn red when mature, containing several seeds. Urera tuberculata is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
